Title: A principled way to solve problems

Today Iâ€™m writing some short thoughts on how to design solutions or decide on actions when you face a new problem.
TL;DR constantly ask yourself what you are trying to do.  One of the main lessons Iâ€™ve learned in this short time working in research (as an intern), is to be methodological. Especially when you are doing something from scratch, when there isnâ€™t a clear roadmap, or when there is a lot of uncertainty and many options/things to do.
